item.title: Feature Flags in .NET and How I Use Them for A/B Testing
item.description: The ability to conditionally turn features on or off in your application without redeploying the code is a powerful tool. It lets you quickly iterate on new features and frequently integrate your changes with the main branch. You can use feature flags to achieve this. Feature flags are a software development technique that allows you to wrap application features in a conditional statement. You can then toggle the feature on or off in runtime to control which features are enabled.
item.author: (Milan Jovanović)

item.title: Backup the caravan
item.description: Second in my series of Tales From Tech Support. Some stories from the past featuring broken computers and even more broken tech support operatives - mostly me. In the early 1990s I worked as a Technician at a local college. I would set-up and tear down experiments for students. I’d also have to look for ‘booby-traps’ they’d set for us. But that’s another story. I would sometimes get called upon to perform technical support for external organisations.

Recently Unity announced a pricing update which changes the pricing model from a simple pay per seat to a model whereby developers have to pay per install. This isn't restricted to paid installs or plays; it applies to every plain install.
This price change has some particularly grave consequence

item.title: .NET Conf 2023 - Local Event Proposal
item.description: .NET Conf is a free, three-day, virtual developer event that celebrates the major releases of the .NET development platform - such as the launch of .NET 8 at .NET Conf 2023 on November 14th.Be a part of history and organize a .NET 8 event for your community or Meetup group and we will give you all the technical content, promotion, and SWAG needed to create an awesome event! Organize an event any time from November 2023 - February 2024 and we will provide you:SWAG for you and your attendees!Technical content and presentation slides.Digital artwork to promote your event and local user group/s.Promotion of your event through #dotnetconf and on the dedicated events page (coming soon!) By filling out this form, if your event proposal is approved you agree to:Act as the main point of contact.Coordinate a .NET 8 event for a local community group or meetup.Title your event ".NET Conf 2023 [Name of your community group/location]" For an in-person event, be responsible for the venue, local promotion, and event registration.  For a virtual event, be responsible for setting up, managing, and producing your event stream. DISCLAIMER: One event per submission. Events can be virtual or in-person. Physical SWAG is first come, first serve, and supplies are limited. Due to international law, some event locations will be excluded from SWAG shipments. Reactor support is based on availability and live event scope. MVPs/RDs must include Contributor/Sharing ID for contribution credit. All information provided will only be used for the purposes of .NET Conf 2023 event planning/scheduling. No promotion or marketing material will be sent. All information will be permanently deleted within 30 days past your event date. For more information, please refer to our Microsoft Privacy Statement: https://privacy.microsoft.com/privacystatement.
